content:
Wikilink Opportunities: Connecting the Thread-Weaving Posts

How to Use This Guide

  1. Open each file mentioned below
  2. Find the line number
  3. Add the suggested wikilink inline (Obsidian style: [filenam](filenam)e]])
  4. The connection should feel natural, not forced
  5. Only add if it actually enhances the reading

personal-apis.md → quantified-self-as-archaeology.md

Line 24: Where you mention "quantified self and the Feltron annual report"

Line 46: "I still suck but at least it's quantified now"

hidden-networks-of-warmth.md → Multiple Connections

Line 23: The preparation quote

Line 33: The motorcycle gear quote

Line 37: The minimalist thinking paragraph

Line 41: The Tufte reference

project-notes/scrapbook.md → Multiple Connections

Line 21: "multiple lenses or interfaces"

Line 29: "Alfred workflow enables lightning-fast local searches"

Line 51-58: The four interface modes

Connecting New Robot Posts to Each Other

In scrapbook-core-digital-memory.md

Add near the end:

In delete-driven-development.md

Add in "Connecting to Other Work" section:

In vulpes-theme-lab-terminal-aesthetics.md

Add near the ±7° explanation:

In logbook-analysis-ten-years-tasks.md

Add in intro:

In coachartie-multi-interface-ai.md

Add near "The Three Interfaces":

In connectology-network-thinking.md

Add in "The 52% Reduction Story":

In hexagram-news-dual-views.md

Add in "The Two Modes":

In morning-radio-ios-curation.md

Add in "6-Factor Priority Scoring":

In website2-obsidian-pipeline.md

Add in multiple places:

In meta-patterns-100-projects.md

This should link to EVERYTHING:

In mcp-purge-story.md

Add near lessons:

In scrapers-consolidation.md

Add:

In minimalism-as-technical-practice.md

Add in examples:

In preparation-as-practice.md

Add throughout:

General Wikilink Principles

Good wikilinks:

  • Enhance understanding
  • Create discovery paths
  • Feel natural in context
  • Add value to reader

Bad wikilinks:

  • Every mention of a word
  • Forced connections
  • Link for link's sake
  • Interrupt reading flow

Best practice:

  • First mention in a section gets the link
  • Use pipe syntax for natural reading: [file|display tex](file|display-tex)t]]
  • Link to deepen, not just connect
  • "See also" sections at end for related threads

Quick-Add Checklist

  • personal-apis.md → quantified-self link (line 24)
  • hidden-networks-of-warmth.md → preparation link (line 23)
  • hidden-networks-of-warmth.md → minimalism link (line 33, 37, 41)
  • project-notes/scrapbook.md → interfaces link (line 21, 29)
  • Add "Related Threads" to all robot posts
  • Add cross-links between robot posts
  • meta-patterns links to all 5 thread posts

After Adding Links

Run Obsidian's graph view to see the connections emerge. The thread-weaving posts should become hub nodes connecting multiple projects and themes.

The goal: Anyone reading one post can discover the broader patterns through natural exploration.
